definition: poor/destitute/to use up/to exhaust/thoroughly/extremely/(coll.) persistently and pointlessly
Archimedes' method of exhaustion (an early form of integral calculus)

sentences.english: The territory trait of trademark right should not be taken to deny the rationality of international exhaustion doctrine.
sentences.chinese: 商标权的地域性特点不能否定国际穷竭原则的合理性。

sentences.english: This element is the basis for the exhaustion of right.
sentences.chinese: 此要件为权利穷竭的基础。

sentences.english: Exhaustion of trademark rights is an important system in trademark law.
sentences.chinese: 商标权权利穷竭是商标法上的重要制度。

sentences.english: The right of lease for the owner of copyright is not an exception to the theory of "exhaustion of rights".
sentences.chinese: 著作权人出租权的享有并非“权利穷竭”理论的例外。

definition: to use up/to exhaust/to probe to the bottom/limit/end
that being the case/then/in that case
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
wear and tear/to wear away over time
